fields.Dialogue Text: Dark cloud? That sounds unpleasantly familiar...

fields.Dialogue Text: "You know what..." He falls silent and the emerging smile withdraws. "No. They brought me misery, false hope, and disappointment. The *revolutionaries* sullied them."

fields.Dialogue Text: Like a machine.

fields.Dialogue Text: I'm satisfied with this explanation.

fields.Title: You: ""I've been through worse.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I've been through worse."

fields.Title: Endurance: "Duty, medals, honour, chain of comm..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Duty, medals, honour, chain of command -- I like this guy. He's not a pansy. I don't like pansies.

fields.Dialogue Text: "They used cocaine for *clarity of vision*?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""No one. The booth has been unmanne..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No one. The booth has been unmanned since last Monday." He looks suddenly very old and tired. "There's no other guard. It's just me."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Hopefully it will finally take you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hopefully it will finally take your fat ass to the other side of a cardiac arrest, Gaston." His words are slow and deliberate. "This doesn't mean anything. Doesn't *change* anything."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""All of *this*..." -- he points to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "All of *this*..." -- he points to you -- "is very unprofessional. Makes me think the Citizens Militia is nothing but a badly organised band of bullies and jesters. Again: I *don't* like this."

fields.Title: You: ""C'mon, I was only joking around.""

fields.Title: Endurance: "It's his heart."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's his heart.

fields.Title: You: ""What do you mean *find*? This is m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you mean *find*? This is my rifle, I always have it with me."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Maybe on some remote parts of the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Maybe on some remote parts of the city they do." The old carabineer shrugs. "But I think you have to wait for at least a month."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""*You* do not speak his name, crave..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*You* do not speak his name, craven! Although he was a clown..." he adds. He turns back to you. "But he was *our* clown. Ours to ridicule -- and to mourn."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""It was on the first months of the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was on the first months of the Revolution here in Revachol. Unrest was spreading like wildfire. Marauders had taken most of the Couron and were getting *really* ambitious."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""When I came to, it was all over,"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "When I came to, it was all over," he continues, ignoring his companion. "It was just me and jawless Drysant, gurgling in the blood-soaked mud right next to me."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "No, you got this! There's the ball..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, you got this! There's the ball -- you're the game!

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm an old man, don't sleep more t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm an old man, don't sleep more than a few hours every night anyway and... money is tight," he adds with a slight sigh.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Yes, yes. Like I said," he brings..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, yes. Like I said," he brings it up again, "I would be up *anyway*, so might as well keep an eye out. It keeps my senses sharp."

fields.Title: You: ""Alright, let's back up to a less s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright, let's back up to a less sensitive subject, okay?"

Composure: "All you observe is a veteran refusi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All you observe is a veteran refusing to let go of the past and his old uniform. This is not uncommon.

fields.Title: You: "How many medals are there?"
fields.Dialogue Text: How many medals are there?

fields.Title: You: ""Seems to me a leader should take c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Seems to me a leader should take care of his *people* before himself."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm not sure how I feel about that.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not sure how I feel about that."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""A nation is only as strong *as* it..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A nation is only as strong *as* its leader. That's why it was such madness to try to..."

fields.Title: You: ""Thanks for clearing that up. I hav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Thanks for clearing that up. I have some other questions now."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""No -- we were the last ones to kee..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No -- we were the last ones to keep all the baby killers and rapists in check, and let me tell you, son..." His eyes find yours. "If there hadn't been Royal Carabineers, Revachol might not be standing at all."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't think it was an excellen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He doesn't think it was an excellent job at all -- he's disappointed.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, gentlemen..." The lieutenant..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, gentlemen..." The lieutenant addresses the men in a casual manner. "If my partner doesn't have any other questions, we'll take off."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Officer," the other one jumps in...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Officer," the other one jumps in. "Let's not get sidetracked here with this nasty business. I know you wanted something from old René or me. Let's talk about that instead."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Purple velvet tunic," the lieutena..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Purple velvet tunic," the lieutenant says thoughtfully. "That isn't exactly *camo*."

fields.Title: Volition: "Hang on to the story -- veterans ge..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hang on to the story -- veterans get sentimental after such *retellings* -- this might yield something useful.

fields.Title: Drama: "He's lying."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's lying.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""It's not charity. Not to me..." Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's not charity. Not to me..." There's a grimace of pain on the old soldier's face. Looks like he wants to add something, but can't find the words. Finally his eyes light up and he says:

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Look, officer..." He pauses like h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Look, officer..." He pauses like he doesn't actually know how to reply. "Can we conclude the topic of my guard booth now?"

fields.Title: Composure: "Something about him has changed. He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Something about him has changed. He's calmer somehow.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""What *Monseigneur Modestie* is not..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What *Monseigneur Modestie* is not telling you is that he crawled over seven kilometres before the cavalrymen found him and Drysant. Two days later that was."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""For doing my duty in the heat of b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "For doing my duty in the heat of battle, for looking my mortality in the eye, when men like Gaston here hid in the bushes and shat themselves..."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "These manly men are playing *balls*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: These manly men are playing *balls*. This is a *ball* game. Grab a ball and play it. Don't ask questions. Shoot first, ask questions never.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Forgetting those times means the m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Forgetting those times means the mistakes were for nothing. That all those people died for nothing."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "His features stiffen and he gets a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His features stiffen and he gets a cold look. "She... is nobody. This is none of your concern and I refuse to discuss my private affairs with the RCM."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""The lady is Jeanne-Marie Beaulieu...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The lady is Jeanne-Marie Beaulieu." Gaston speaks with a soft voice. "And she sure as hell wasn't a nobody."

fields.Title: You: "I'm on it, coach!"
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm on it, coach!

fields.Title: You: ""How should a true king rule?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "How should a true king rule?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Revachol would be a different plac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Revachol would be a different place if more people realized that." He gently rubs his chest. "We could still be the..."

fields.Title: You: ""I too have travelled to higher rea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I too have travelled to higher realms..."

fields.Title: You: ""Seems like irresponsible behaviour..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Seems like irresponsible behaviour for a monarch. Drug users shouldn't even operate heavy machinery, much less rule countries."

fields.Title: You: ""Sounds like you're being modest, R..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sounds like you're being modest, René."

fields.Title: You: "Why are you so mean to me?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Why are you so mean to me?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Excellent job bullying that old ma..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Excellent job bullying that old man, officer," the lieutenant says with a frown. He looks impatient and not happy. "He'll be sure to put in a good word for the RCM in the future."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's right, you know?" The lieuten..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "He's right, you know?" The lieutenant nods towards René. "We're supposed to protect people -- not take advantage of them. Now wrap this up."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not, the officer was just......"
fields.Dialogue Text: "We're not, the officer was just..." The lieutenant falls silent, looking for words to justify your sandwich antics.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""That's why the Filippian kings use..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's why the Filippian kings used cocaine -- for clarity of vision, to aid in their work... Regnum Cocainum -- Revachol's finest years." He seems to grow taller, brimming with pride about the past.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm fine, goddamnit! Mind your own..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm fine, goddamnit! Mind your own business!" The outburst makes him clutch his chest. "It's nothing, just got to cut back on coffee."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "He's just making excuses for the ki..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's just making excuses for the king's habits, isn't he?

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""For bravery," he interjects."
fields.Dialogue Text: "For bravery," he interjects.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""King Frissel thought he could end..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "King Frissel thought he could end it all in one decisive strike." The old carabineer runs his fingers over the larger medal. "Sent his cousin, Drysant, to put an end to the unrest."

fields.Title: You: ""What a dandy!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What a dandy!"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Do not speak of what you know noth..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do not speak of what you know nothing about, poltroon!" He slams the heel of his boot in the ground. "*Duty* is something you will never understand."

fields.Title: Jump to: [PREHUB RENKU]
René Arnoux: ""Yes, the Débardeurs' Union pays me..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, the Débardeurs' Union pays me to stand vigil during the nights." He looks down. "Not out of any *political* allegiance, mind you."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "He gives Gaston a hateful look. "I..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He gives Gaston a hateful look. "I won her back, but while I was dealing with some... issues..."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""NO," the old soldier exclaims shar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "NO," the old soldier exclaims sharply. "I don't understand, what you're trying to accomplish with this... sandwich *bonanza*, but I already don't like it." He crosses his arms.

fields.Title: Untitled hub (03)
René Arnoux: ""I'm listening." He doesn't sound t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm listening." He doesn't sound too pleased to have his praises to the miracle of cocaine-fuelled kingship cut short.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""From what I've seen of the officer..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "From what I've seen of the officers of the RCM..." he begins, looking you over, then stops himself. "But I don't want to get into a debate about drug policies."

fields.Title: Composure: "A crowned head in front of two cros..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A crowned head in front of two crossed rifles. The medal hangs from a blue striped triangle.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Not a soul."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not a soul.

fields.Title: You: ""I drink alcohol and go to heaven...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I drink alcohol and go to heaven..."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I didn't think you had the stomach..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I didn't think you had the stomach for it." He nods grimly. "And I can usually tell."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Fine," he snaps at you, obviously..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Fine," he snaps at you, obviously annoyed for the interruption. "What is it then?"

fields.Title: You: ""René, you were telling me how you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "René, you were telling me how you got the medals, I wanna hear the rest of the story."

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.rene_got_off_the_war_story_after_saying_its_boring"] == true  and  Variable["plaza.rene_left_on_shattered_knee_3rd_exit"] == false  and  Variable["XP.listened_renes_medal_story"] == false

fields.Title: You: ""René, the medal story -- Drysant's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "René, the medal story -- Drysant's horse stepped on your knee, then what happened?"

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "It is not."
fields.Dialogue Text: It is not.

fields.Title: You: ""You must have seen *something* on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You must have seen *something* on the night of the murder. Your booth looks right into the yard."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Yes." He nods, before hesitantly c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes." He nods, before hesitantly continuing. "It's... it's not actually an issue. I mean..."

fields.Title: You: ""Such dependency only weakens a man..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Such dependency only weakens a man further. Do or die -- there is no middle ground."

fields.Title: You: ""In the basement there." (Point at..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "In the basement there." (Point at the book shop.)

fields.Title: You: ""Pretty damn clever indeed.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Pretty damn clever indeed."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Then his horse, driven mad by the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then his horse, driven mad by the noise and smell of gunpowder, stepped on my leg and shattered my knee." He pats his right thigh.

fields.Title: You: ""I'll leave you to it..." [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'll leave you to it..." [Leave.]

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""The purity of snow always reminds..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The purity of snow always reminds me of the purity of a man's soul...." He looks at the falling snow. "If he's got principles."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Those days and memories are gone."..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Those days and memories are gone." He nods and looks René with something resembling compassion.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""We're still waiting for a replacem..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We're still waiting for a replacement for the *boule* you sent sinking."

fields.Title: Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_case"]
Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_case"]
!(Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_case"])
You: ""What was that about cocaine?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What was that about cocaine?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""You can't even take responsibility..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You can't even take responsibility for yourself -- how could you fathom the responsibility weighing on the shoulders of a ruler?" he asks, obviously annoyed.

fields.Title: Jump to: [René Arnoux: ""Right." The old man stands tall an..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, indeed. We are not here to in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, indeed. We are not here to investigate the drug trade of centuries past."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Bah!" His gaze wanders over the ba..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Bah!" His gaze wanders over the bay. "There were many such stories in those days. Many such men too. True Revacholians, men with *backbone*."

fields.Title: You: ""Do *May bells* mean anything to yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do *May bells* mean anything to you, René?" (Show him the flower.)

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "It's clear these words mean a lot t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's clear these words mean a lot to him.

fields.Title: You: ""That's just *your* opinion.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's just *your* opinion."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I doubt it," he remarks dryly. "An..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I doubt it," he remarks dryly. "Anyway, I grabbed the prick and started crawling. Kept going until the 59th Cavalry picked us up."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""You see, officer, René is the kind..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You see, officer, René is the kind of man who'd rather die than admit he needs medical assistance or -- god forbid -- seek it. A real man's man. He's just gonna *ride it out*."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "He nods. "I understand. Unfortunate..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He nods. "I understand. Unfortunately, I don't know what else to tell you. These BM's are an antique. No one uses them anymore. The ammunition is impossible to find."

fields.Title: Empathy: "Could it be... guilt?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Could it be... guilt?

fields.Title: You: ""Did you ever use artillery fire ag..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did you ever use artillery fire against the *communards*?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [René Arnoux: ""Sadly, no. It was the foreigners w..."]
You: ""That's what I was going to say, br..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's what I was going to say, bravery."

fields.Title: Composure: "You sense he's downplaying it -- he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You sense he's downplaying it -- he did a lot more than his duty. More than anyone's duty. It's in his spine, in his billowing breast. An untarnished self worth.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""He saved some *maudit* princeling..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "He saved some *maudit* princeling who foolishly strolled into the front line in his gown of velvet and gold."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""So I grabbed the *dink*," he says,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "So I grabbed the *dink*," he says, with a stern look, "and started crawling. Kept going until the 59th Cavalry picked us up."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""He was the commanding officer and..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "He was the commanding officer and I was on duty. Just doing my job. Shouldn't hand out medals for that..." He shakes his head. "Thirteen months later I received 'The Sun'. For distinguished service. It's not worth mentioning."

fields.Title: You: ""You seem to be playing in a crater.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "You seem to be playing in a crater."

fields.Title: You: ""You looked happy in the picture. S..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You looked happy in the picture. Smiling."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh absolutely..." He smiles as if..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh absolutely..." He smiles as if reliving a pleasant memory. "At the mercy of a cocaine-snorting tyrant who emptied the treasury so he could sleep on a bed of gold?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""You haven't lived as long as I hav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You haven't lived as long as I have, son. With age, a man learns certain things about real power -- or else ends up a spineless socialist rat, like Gaston here."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""It's a private matter," he says wi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's a private matter," he says with dignity. "Nothing to do with your investigation."

fields.Title: You: ""There's absolutely *nothing* wrong..."

fields.Title: Jump to: [makeitorbreakit]
René Arnoux: ""It's a *Belle-Magrave*," he says,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's a *Belle-Magrave*," he says, taking the rifle. "4.46 calibre, breech-loading, Revachol-made. Good weapon, accurate and reliable."

fields.Title: You: ""Not for raping women or...?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Not for raping women or...?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm sure. But I know this uniform'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm sure. But I know this uniform's reputation: You were also wondering if I got these for raping women or killing babies."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I grabbed my sidearm and shot the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I grabbed my sidearm and shot the beast in the head. Then everything went black."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""*Capitaine Arnoux -- le fléau des..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Capitaine Arnoux -- le fléau des chevaux*!"

You: "Alright, I got this -- ball time!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Alright, I got this -- ball time!

fields.Title: You: ""A moment of your time, fellows." (..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A moment of your time, fellows." (Don't get involved in the game.)

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I hope you pass out from it, you g..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I hope you pass out from it, you goddamn jellyfish. Men like you are the reason this nation is sinking." Standing tall and proud, he looks at his partner with disgust.

You: ""Powerful leaders -- not afraid to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Powerful leaders -- not afraid to do what *must* be done -- that's what this country needs."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "'Higher realms'? Of course -- it al..."
fields.Dialogue Text: 'Higher realms'? Of course -- it all makes sense...

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "He glances at it and frowns. "I pre..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He glances at it and frowns. "I prefer the old name -- Insulindian Lily. Girls brought them to young cadets when they entered service. Wearing them on your cap was supposed to bring good luck."

fields.Title: You: ""Did they bring you good luck?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did they bring you good luck?"

fields.Title: Empathy: "You can feel the jolly man pull bac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You can feel the jolly man pull back. This hurt. More than he was ready for.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Ugh..." The old man looks at you,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ugh..." The old man looks at you, obviously annoyed by the interruption. "Sure. Yes. Yes, you can ask your questions."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "The bane of horses."
fields.Dialogue Text: The bane of horses.

fields.Title: Jump to: [René Arnoux: ""For doing my duty in the heat of b..."]
Savoir Faire: "You can. It's very *asinine*."
fields.Dialogue Text: You can. It's very *asinine*.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""The *possibility* of someone being..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The *possibility* of someone being in there is enough to discourage any ill-minded individuals..." he tries to argue.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No one has been guarding the conta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No one has been guarding the container yard since last Monday?"

fields.Title: Untitled hub
Volition: "He wants to argue, disagree -- but..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He wants to argue, disagree -- but feels he's got no right, being at the mercy of Mr. Claire.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "He is not going to become an entrep..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He is not going to become an entrepreneur.

fields.Title: You: ""Must have been a bloodpath.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Must have been a bloodpath."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Right." The old man stands tall an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Right." The old man stands tall and proud, looking at you inquisitively.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Your munching has ruined my concen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Your munching has ruined my concentration!"

fields.Title: You: ""I'm not impressed. All those heroi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not impressed. All those heroics and where is he now? No, you gotta play to win. Look after *you* first."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "The old soldier says nothing, but w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The old soldier says nothing, but when his glance quickly runs over Gaston's face, there's an odd look in his eyes.

fields.Title: Jump to: [RENE MAIN HUB]
René Arnoux: ""Fine." He takes the *boule*. "You..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Fine." He takes the *boule*. "You tried to right a wrong. It's still a gram better than actual *nothing*."

fields.Title: You: ""Exactly. And I *really* did try.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Exactly. And I *really* did try."

fields.Title: You: ""There's not gonna be an alternativ..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "There's not gonna be an alternative. I suggest taking it."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""No-no, officer! René doesn't know..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No-no, officer! René doesn't know what he's saying." The jolly one jumps in.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Yes," he says impatiently. "I was..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes," he says impatiently. "I was standing right here. I saw it. Why are you telling me this?"

Electrochemistry: "Cocaine? Cocainum? Sounds like our..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Cocaine? Cocainum? Sounds like our kind of king. And -- just imagine! -- what kind of cocaine a king would have had...

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know the reputation of......"
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know the reputation of... *anything*. Don't even recognize the war."

fields.Title: You: ""Thanks for the story, René!" (Conc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Thanks for the story, René!" (Conclude.)

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""That's right." The former soldier..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's right." The former soldier nods, his fists curling in a ball. "And I'm *sharing* it with you so you can better yourself..."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Whoaa... sounds like you're about t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whoaa... sounds like you're about to open the gates of conversation -- this man will literally talk your ear off, if you let him wander off to Memory Lane.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm *not* getting into this with y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm *not* getting into this with you again." He mumbles through clenched teeth and turns to you. "Officer, was there anything else?"

fields.Title: You: ""This doesn't seem like a good mome..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This doesn't seem like a good moment to express an opinion." (Lean closer.) "I don't wanna risk it."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, I didn't mean to imply there's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, I didn't mean to imply there's something *wrong* with that," the jolly man says quickly. "I do it too. Everyone does it. It's an excellent side-thing."

fields.Title: You: ""The medals." (Point to his chest.)..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The medals." (Point to his chest.) "Did you get them for..."
fields.Alternate1: "*Croix de Bravoure* and The Setting Sun." (Point to his chest.) "Did you get them for..."
fields.Alternate2: "*Croix de Bravoure*..." (Point to his chest.) "Did you get it for..."
fields.Alternate3: "The Setting Sun..." (Point to his chest.) "Did you get it for..."

fields.Title: You: ""No, I really wasn't, I'm just aski..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, I really wasn't, I'm just asking."

fields.Title: You: ""So, did you?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "So, did you?"

René Arnoux: ""...a superpower, feared and respec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "...a superpower, feared and respected. A testament to what this country *can* be under the leadership of a True King, someone who knows how to rule."

fields.Title: You: ""Let's talk about something else.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let's talk about something else."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Son, we should never forget our pa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Son, we should never forget our past. Lots of mistakes were made back then, but they were also lessons." His voice takes on a tutor-like quality.

fields.Title: You: ""I'm just gonna go -- we'll all for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just gonna go -- we'll all forget about it at some point." [Leave.]

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Didn't think you had the stomach f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Didn't think you had the stomach for it." He nods grimly. "Kids don't these days. I'm used to that."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Honour is everything to me," he sa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Honour is everything to me," he says with grim finality.

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "He really despises that Drysant fel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He really despises that Drysant fellow.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "It is the *Croix de Bravoure* -- Cr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It is the *Croix de Bravoure* -- Cross of Valour. The Cross was the highest battlefield decoration in the Suzerain's armed forces, awarded for exceptional bravery in the line of duty in service of King Frissel the First.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""The dink had taken numerous flesh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The dink had taken numerous flesh wounds and lost a lot of blood, but despite missing his jaw he seemed hesitant to die. Tougher than he looked, that one."

fields.Title: You: "Shouldn't I ask what game it is fir..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shouldn't I ask what game it is first?

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I like playing in the dark. Sharpe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I like playing in the dark. Sharpens your nocturnal instincts... Feels like being on recon again."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Offic... argh..." He rubs his ches..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Offic... argh..." He rubs his chest and spits. "Goddamnit... pull yourself together, René." He turns to you. "What do you want?"

fields.Dialogue Text: The old veteran stares at the shot put ball in silence, then speaks in a reserved voice: "What is this? Are you mocking us? This isn't for pétanque."

fields.Title: You: "René told you his war story, now im..."
fields.Dialogue Text: René told you his war story, now impress him with *your* heroics.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""He didn't." A shadow of respect cr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "He didn't." A shadow of respect crosses his face. "I hoisted the prick on my back and started crawling. Kept going until the 59th Cavalry picked us up."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Sorry, officer, but you're reading..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sorry, officer, but you're reading me all wrong." He chuckles. "I'm a man of peace and these kinds of bloody 'heroics' are only impressive to men like René himself. Certainly not to me."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""How did *you* find the story to be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "How did *you* find the story to be, officer?"

fields.Dialogue Text: *The Setting Sun* was a decoration used to distinguish seasoned combat veterans in service of King Frissel the First during the Revolution.

fields.Dialogue Text: "I understand Jeanne-Marie meant a lot to you?"

fields.Dialogue Text: "Can you please stop whining for one second and let me take the shot."

fields.Dialogue Text: "I found you guys a new *boule*." (Hold out the ball.)

fields.Title: You: ""No reason, never mind." (Keep the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No reason, never mind." (Keep the sandwich.)

fields.Title: Composure: "Two. The larger one is shaped like..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Two. The larger one is shaped like a cross, while the smaller medal resembles the sun.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Ah, yes, King Filippe III on his s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ah, yes, King Filippe III on his steed -- a reminder of what Revachol once was..."

fields.Title: Drama: "No, he really believes what he's sa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, he really believes what he's saying -- he has completely accepted the narrative of transcendence through cocaine use.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""And the worst part of that, office..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And the worst part of that, officer," he says, face terrified, "is having to spend your days playing pétanque with an angry snake."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""It's really not." He turns to René..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's really not." He turns to René. "Please do spare us the cocaine fairy tales."

René Arnoux: ""You are representing an organisati..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You are representing an organisation, an insignia, an idea." The old man continues in a softer tone. "You need to understand that."

fields.Title: You: ""Sounds like there's a story there,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sounds like there's a story there, but I'd like to talk about something else right now."

fields.Title: Jump to: [René Arnoux: ""I grabbed my sidearm and shot the..."]
René Arnoux: ""Royal blood alone doesn't make arm..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Royal blood alone doesn't make army commanders. He was a stupid kid, only interested in horses, hair styles, and *manloving*." He spits. "And *seven hundred and eighty two* Royal Carabineers are dead because of his incompetence."

fields.Title: You: ""Evrart gets it. Big guys looking a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Evrart gets it. Big guys looking after the small and everyone working together -- I love it!"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Yes, yes, yes," the carabineer utt..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, yes, yes," the carabineer utters angrily. "Can we conclude the topic of my guard booth now?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Anything else I can assist you wit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Anything else I can assist you with, officer?" he asks impatiently. "We still have a game to finish."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""As for the rifle -- I don't know w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "As for the rifle -- I don't know what else to tell you." He shrugs. "These BM446s are an antique. No one uses them anymore. The ammunition is impossible to find."

fields.Title: You: ""Mostly decorative?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Mostly decorative?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "He catches your glance and nods. "T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He catches your glance and nods. "This is the uniform of the Royal Carabineers in service of Frissel the First, Guillaume *Le Lion*, and the valiant King Filippe the Fifth before him."

fields.Title: You: ""Not for killing babies or...?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Not for killing babies or...?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Alas, the young Drysant was all pi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alas, the young Drysant was all piss and no vinegar, wearing a tunic of purple velvet and cockatoo feathers to battle." He spits. "Even his rifle was *gold-plated*. Shone from five klicks away. Can you imagine the asininity?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""The rebels were smart. They let us..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The rebels were smart. They let us come real close before opening fire. Suffice to say, it was carnage."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "Shush! Ignore them! They don't know..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shush! Ignore them! They don't know what they're doing. They're *old*! You are letting down yourself and the team. Get in the damn game already!

fields.Title: You: ""René, I found your guard booth.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "René, I found your guard booth."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Vigilance, officer!" He salutes yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Vigilance, officer!" He salutes you. "What can this old carabineer do for you?"

fields.Title: makeitorbreakit
You: ""I said I wouldn't do it, but I fou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I said I wouldn't do it, but I found you a new *boule*."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, well..." The lieutenant looks..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, well..." The lieutenant looks uncomfortable. "Let's just wrap this up and try to think about these things in the future."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I didn't find it funny.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I didn't find it funny."

fields.Title: Jump to: [RENE MAIN HUB]
Pain Threshold: "It's painful to even think about."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's painful to even think about.

fields.Title: You: ""Why do you despise Drysant so much?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why do you despise Drysant so much?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "The old carabineer stands quietly l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The old carabineer stands quietly like a statue, his features motionless.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course," the lieutenant marks d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course," the lieutenant marks dryly. "Clarity of vision. *Awareness*."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Because he was a *god damn* dandy!..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Because he was a *god damn* dandy!" he exclaims furiously. "Had no business leading men or even being on the battlefield. All he was, was *related*. That's it."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Yes. It does." He nods. "Unfortuna..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. It does." He nods. "Unfortunately I wasn't working that night. Been on a two-week leave since last Monday."

fields.Title: You: ""Thank you for your time!" [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Thank you for your time!" [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: ""Bastards..." (Slowly shake your he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Bastards..." (Slowly shake your head.)

fields.Title: RENE MAIN HUB
You: ""Saved a princeling?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Saved a princeling?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm trying to, but you keep breaki..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm trying to, but you keep breaking my concentration. You're old, I can see that. We're both old. Now stop grabbing your ass like it's a girl."

Jump to: [RENE MAIN HUB]
René Arnoux: ""*Decisively*. Without fear of offe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Decisively*. Without fear of offending the sensibilities of the frail and weak-minded among his subjects! This is something the insurgents never understood..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, old Filippe was a *big* fan of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, old Filippe was a *big* fan of the purple nose candy the nobility loved so much. A cocaine-connoisseur of sorts." He chuckles. "His egocentricity is borderline legendary."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: "The carabineer doesn't reply, but h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The carabineer doesn't reply, but his entire being communicates unbreakable resolve.

fields.Title: You: "Look at the cross."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look at the cross.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""But it wasn't the revolutionaries..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "But it wasn't the revolutionaries that *sullied* the idea for you, was it?" He looks at the old soldier almost gently. "She gave them to me too and your jealous little heart just couldn't accept it."

You: ""You're right, I should have though..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You're right, I should have thought about it."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Untitled hub (03)]
You: ""I myself use *speed* to transcend...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I myself use *speed* to transcend..."

fields.Title: You: ""I'd give up. Can't imagine living..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'd give up. Can't imagine living without my jaw." (Touch your jaw.)

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "You should try to come up with a he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You should try to come up with a heroic story of your own -- impress this old soldier.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Evrart *created* this job for René..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Evrart *created* this job for René, because he knows the Royal Carabineer's pension of honour and PTSD isn't something a man can live off. 'A decorated kingsman collecting tare reflects bad on the whole neighbourhood.' -- his words."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm not surprised." He looks at th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not surprised." He looks at the building. "There are probably lots of forgotten war-time weapons lying around here. Back in the day, everyone had *something* stashed away."

fields.Title: You: ""So what *did* you get the medals f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "So what *did* you get the medals for?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I got shot in the left shoulder an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I got shot in the left shoulder and went down. Just a flesh wound, but just as I turned over, the prince fell into the mud next to me. He was missing his lower jaw."

fields.Title: You: ""Okay... then what did you do?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay... then what did you do?"

fields.Title: You: ""That's no dink, that's a fighter!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's no dink, that's a fighter!"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""And that even whilst crawling with..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And that even whilst crawling with a mangled half-dead prince on his back, he still managed to murder three rebels on his way."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Trying to throw something as close..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Trying to throw something as close to a predetermined point as possible... measuring... this must be the age-old game of pétanque.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Have you no shame," the man says t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Have you no shame," the man says to his partner, "whining about your back every time you bring out the measuring tape?"

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "You're such a wuss!"
fields.Dialogue Text: You're such a wuss!

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Look. Look! In his hand, going into..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look. Look! In his hand, going into his mouth! The sandwich, it's hauntingly beautiful!

fields.Title: You: ""Were the circumstances of her deat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Were the circumstances of her death in any sense...*unusual*?"

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "'The Ikeira Operation' was a seven-..."
fields.Dialogue Text: 'The Ikeira Operation' was a seven-year campaign during which Suzerain Guillaume's army forcefully united the people in the southeastern part of Le Petit Continent, collectively known as the Ikeira tribes, under the Revacholian banner.

fields.Title: Jump to: [RENE MAIN HUB]
Gaston Martin: ""Ah, *mon dieu*! The pain in my bac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ah, *mon dieu*! The pain in my back is unbearable. I can't even say if it's in my back or hip anymore. Feels like it's in *both*!" He tries to measure the throw.

fields.Dialogue Text: "Not this again..." you hear the lieutenant mumble under his breath.

fields.Title: You: ""I... saw a picture in there. You w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I... saw a picture in there. You were in it. Who's the girl?"
fields.Alternate1: "I... saw a picture in there. You were in it. You looked... happy. Who's the girl?"

fields.Title: Composure: "There's something you missed... You..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's something you missed... You will get to it, don't worry.

fields.Title: You: ""Sounds controversial. Let's talk a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sounds controversial. Let's talk about something else."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Right, right..." -- he doesn't get..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Right, right..." -- he doesn't get sidetracked -- "so I grabbed the prick and started crawling. Kept going until the 59th Cavalry picked us up."

You: ""Do you know anything about the man..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do you know anything about the man hanged in the back yard of Whirling-in-Rags?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""To keep the long and bloody story..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "To keep the long and bloody story short, Drysant marched us against the partisans in Couron. And when I say 'marched', I mean made us walk into captured enemy territory single-file, like toy soldiers, while he rode in front on his giant red stallion."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""René, you're a man with a fork in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "René, you're a man with a fork in a world of soup. Please... let's just try to enjoy the game, alright?" The other one is eating a big sandwich.

fields.Title: You: ""What happened with you, Gaston, an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What happened with you, Gaston, and Jeanne-Marie?"

fields.Title: Endurance: "This man seems to be experiencing a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This man seems to be experiencing a mild to medium level of congestive heart problems, either due to narrowing of the arteries or high blood pressure.

fields.Title: Jump to: [plaza.rene_hero_Story_rc]
René Arnoux: ""Everything *you* do reflects on th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Everything *you* do reflects on the idea and the people you are representing. When we," he says, pointing to Gaston, "think of the RCM, we think of *you*. Please make it a pleasant thought."

fields.Title: You: ""I managed to get my hands on Gasto..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I managed to get my hands on Gaston's sandwich."

fields.Title: Composure: "As René turns from you to his partn..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As René turns from you to his partner and back, the medals on his chest rattle and glare. He keeps his spine straight and his ribcage lifted, displaying them proudly.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "But imagine -- purest cocaine... No..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But imagine -- purest cocaine... Now that would make you feel like a king. Not that you can afford it. But a man can dream, right? In another time and place...

fields.Title: You: ""What was that about higher realms?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What was that about higher realms? Sounds interesting."
